bibl.title: Appointment of John E. Taylor by Isaac Mayo, August 14, 1853
Despatches from United States Consuls in Sierra Leone, 1858-1906 T-438

div1.p: By virtue of Authority vested in me as Commander in Chief of the United States Naval Forces on the West Coast of Africa, I hereby appoint John E. Taylor, Acting Consul of the United States of America, for the Colony of Sierra Leone on the West Coast of Africa, and do authorize and empower him to have and to hold the said Office and to exercise and enjoy all the rights, pre-eminences, priveleges, and authorities, to the same if right appertaining: during the pleasure of the President of the United States, or of the Commander in Chief on the West Coast of Africa, for the time being, he demanding and receiving no fees or perquisites of office whatsoever, which shall not be expressly established by some law of the United States.

And I do hereby enjoin all Captains, Masters, and Commanders of Ships and other vessels, armed or unarmed, sailing under the Flag of the said States, as well as all other of their citizens to acknowledgement and
and consider him, the said John E. Taylor. accordingly

And I do hereby pray and request the Governor and Officers of the Colony of Sierra Leone to permit the said John E. Taylor, fully and peacefully to enjoy and exercise the said Office, without or suffering to be given onto him, any molestation or trouble; but on the , to afford him all proper and assistance in accordance with the usage happily existing between the Government of Great Britain, and of the United States of America.
Given under my hand on board the U.S. Flag Ship Constitution at Sierra Leone the 14th day of August, in the year of our Lord, One thousand eighth hundred and fifty three.

closer.signed:
(sl) I. Mayo
Commander in Chief
U.S Naval Forces West Coast Africa
